intro: Hieracium breve, commonly known as the short hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium breve is often found in meadows, pastures, and woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
